datafield.subfield: Numerical Simulation of Gas-Solid Flow in a Wurster Fluidized Bed

The process in a fluidized bed with Wurster tube is complex due to the gas-solid two-phase flow inside the bed and it is important to investigate the flow hydrodynamic characteristics in the process. Computational Fluid Dynamic (CFD) is one of the effective approaches to monitor the flow characteristics in the bed. In this paper, Eulerian-Eulerian-based two-fluid model (TFM) is used to investigate the hydrodynamic characteristics of the gas-solid flow. The main parameters are analyzed, including solid volume fraction, pressure distribution, granular axial and radial velocity, and the influence of gas velocity, which is crucial to improve the process efficiency and the end-point product quality.
